text: The Resistible Rise of Arturo Ui (), known "A parable play", is a 1941 play by the German playwright Bertolt Brecht. It is about the rise of Arturo Ui, a fictional 1930s Chicago mobster, and his attempts to control the cauliflower racket by killing his business enemies. The play is an satirical allegory of the rise of Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party. ==References== ==Other websites== * , BBC 1972 version with Nicol Williamson and Jill Townsend *Photos and production details for 1960s Leonard Rossiter theatre adaptation Category:German plays Category:1940s plays Category:1941 works
title: The Resistible Rise of Arturo Ui
